Articles.Content:
After the recent discovery of aviation, RoboCorp has branched out into the construction of atmospheric vehicles.

Once again attempting to bridge the gap between useful and utterly crazy, RoboCorp brings you:

The Cutter:

> 
> In the SPH:
> 
> ![screenshot27e.png](http://img19.imageshack.us/img19/8417/screenshot27e.png)
> 
> On the runway (With booster assisted launch):
> 
> ![screenshot28r.png](http://img137.imageshack.us/img137/719/screenshot28r.png)
> 
> Can land (always a bonus):
> 
> ![screenshot26s.png](http://img137.imageshack.us/img137/3882/screenshot26s.png)
> 
> Various more or less impressive pictures:
> 
> ![screenshot30b.png](http://img576.imageshack.us/img576/5518/screenshot30b.png)
> 
> ![screenshot29a.png](http://img841.imageshack.us/img841/4549/screenshot29a.png)
> 
> ![screenshot31o.png](http://img27.imageshack.us/img27/2042/screenshot31o.png)
> 
> 

While the airspeed of The Cutter is relatively slow, it has incredible range and looks odd cool.
Reminds me of Cylon Raiders from the original BSG.

I was originally trying to make something resembling the P-38 Lightning ([http://da.wikipedia.org/wiki/P-38_Lightning](https://da.wikipedia.org/wiki/P-38_Lightning)) with a twin tail rudder.

But I ended up with a semi-cirular design useing a single engine.
